voting portals registered. Its rationale is for the Guardian to be able to \"rescue\" the system in case all voting portals were removed by mistake. This is needed because to add a new voting portal a full governance flow is required, and without the portal, the system would be bricked. To limit the Guardian's power, can only happen if there are no voting portals registered, and the guardian could only add one voting portal.","params":{"votingPortal":"address of the new voting VOTING_TOKENS_CAP().details: This cap is used to limit the number of voting tokens, so as to not drain the bridging funds with a message too big.

params.proposalId: id of the proposal to start the voting on

params.votingPortals: array of voting portal addresses to approve

params.ipfsHash: ipfs hash of a document with proposal description
params.payloads: which user propose to vote for
params.votingPortal: address of the contract which will bootstrap voting, and provide results in the end

params.proposalId: id of the proposal to get the information of

returns._0: proposal object containing all the information

params.chainId: id of the chain to get the representative from

returns._0: address of the representative of the voter on chainId

params.chainId: id of the chain to search for represented voters

params.accessLevel: level for which to get the configuration of a vote

returns._0: the voting configuration assigned to the specified accessLevel

params.votingPortal: address of the voting portal to check if approved

returns._0: flag indicating the approval status of the voting portal

params.againstVotes: number of votes against of the proposal
params.forVotes: number of votes in favor of the proposal
params.proposalId: the id of the proposal to queue

params.proposalIds: array of ids of the proposals to redeem the cancellation fee from

removeVotingPortals(address[]).details: removing a voting portal effectively removes a voting machine

params.votingPortals: list of addresses of the voting machines that are no longer valid

rescueVotingPortal(address).details: This method is only callable by the Guardian.This method is only callable when there are no voting portals registered. Its rationale is for the Guardian to be able to "rescue" the system in case all voting portals were removed by mistake. This is needed because to add a new voting portal a full governance flow is required, and without the portal, the system would be bricked. To limit the Guardian's power, can only happen if there are no voting portals registered, and the guardian could only add one voting portal.

params.votingPortal: address of the new voting portal

params.newPowerStrategy: address of the new contract containing the voting a voting strategy

params.votingConfigs: object containing configuration for an access level

params.cancellationFee: the fee amount to collateralize against a proposal cancellation

params.representatives: Array of objects with the representative information

ACHIEVABLE_VOTING_PARTICIPATION().notice: method to get the reasonably achievable voting participation, taking into total supply, and market situation

CANCELLATION_FEE_COLLECTOR().notice: method to get the Cancellation Fee Collector address

COOLDOWN_PERIOD().notice: method to get the cool down period between queuing and execution

MIN_VOTING_DURATION().notice: method to get the minimum voting duration time in seconds

NAME().notice: method to get the name of the contract

PRECISION_DIVIDER().notice: method to get the precision divider used to remove unneeded decimals

PROPOSAL_EXPIRATION_TIME().notice: method to get the expiration time from creation from which the proposal will be invalid

VOTING_TOKENS_CAP().notice: method to get the the voting tokens cap

activateVoting(uint256).notice: method to send proposal to votingMachine

addVotingPortals(address[]).notice: method to approve new voting machines

cancelProposal(uint256).notice: cancels a proposal, can be initiated by guardian,or if proposition power of proposal creator will go below minPropositionPower specified in VotingConfig

createProposal((uint256,uint8,address,ui.notice: creates a proposal, with configuration specified in VotingConfig corresponding to the accessLevel

executeProposal(uint256).notice: executes a proposal, can be called by anyone if proposal in Queued stateand passed more then COOLDOWN_PERIOD seconds after proposal entered this state

getCancellationFee().notice: method to get the cancellation fee

getPowerStrategy().notice: address of the current voting strategy to use on the governance

getProposal(uint256).notice: method to get the proposal identified by passed id

getProposalState(uint256).notice: gets the state of a proposal

getRepresentativeByChain(address,uint256.notice: method to get the representative of a voter on a chain

getRepresentedVotersByChain(address,uint.notice: method to get the voters a representative is representing

getVotingConfig(uint8).notice: method to get the voting configuration from an access level

getVotingPortalsCount().notice: method to get the number of registered voting portals

isVotingPortalApproved(address).notice: method to get if a voting portal is approved by the governance

queueProposal(uint256,uint128,uint128).notice: method to queue a proposal for execution

redeemCancellationFee(uint256[]).notice: method to redeem the cancellation fee from a proposal

removeVotingPortals(address[]).notice: method to remove an accepted voting portal.

rescueVotingPortal(address).notice: method to add a new voting portal

setPowerStrategy(address).notice: method to set a new powerStrategy contract

setVotingConfigs((uint8,uint24,uint24,ui.notice: method to set the voting configuration for a determined access level

updateCancellationFee(uint256).notice: method to update the cancellation fee

updateRepresentativesForChain((address,u.notice: method to update the representative of a voter on certain chain.
